titleStmt.title: The west-country miser: or, An unconscionable farmer's miserable end: who having hoarded up his corn in hopes it would rise to a higher price, was disappointed so that he fell into despair, and died at last by the fright of an apparition. Tune of, Love's sweet passion: or, Fond boy, &c.

The west-country miser: or, An unconscionable farmer's miserable end: who having hoarded up his corn in hopes it would rise to a higher price, was disappointed so that he fell into despair, and died at last by the fright of an apparition. Tune of, Love's sweet passion: or, Fond boy, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Wolrah, in Holbourn.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Let al [sic] loving people be pleas'd to attend ..."
Date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
